alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Lower Snake River Plain; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 6:35AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...LOCALIZED PATCHES OF DENSE FOG CONTINUE THIS MORNING ACROSS THE SNAKE PLAIN, ARCO DESERT, AND MUD LAKE REGIONS... At 635 AM...area weather stations, webcams, and satellite were continuing to monitor pockets of dense fog. Visibility in these pockets ranged from one mile to as low as one-tenth of a mile. The worst and most persistent fog continues along Interstate 15 from Idaho Falls north to Dubois, although intermittent dense fog has occurred elsewhere across the region as well. Model guidance suggests fog will continue into late morning, burning off and ending for most locations between 9 AM and 11 AM. Anyone traveling across the Snake Plain, Arco Desert, and Mud Lake regions this morning should be prepared to suddenly encounter dense fog. When entering fog, slow down, use extreme caution, switch to low beam headlights if possible, and use painted roadway lines to help guide you.

area.areaDesc: Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Lower Snake River Plain; Upper Snake River Plain
